description.value:
The Transfer Summary standardizes critical information for exchange of information between providers of care when a patient moves between health care settings.
Examples of referral situations are when a patient is referred from a family physician to a cardiologist for cardiac evaluation or when patient is sent by a cardiologist to an emergency department for angina or when a patient is referred by a nurse practitioner to an audiologist for hearing screening or when a patient is referred by a hospitalist to social services.

definition.value: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet TransferDocumentType urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20.2.4 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-2496).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] event (CONF:2219-2571).
This event SHALL contain at least one [1..*] C-CDA on FHIR Performer (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/ccda/StructureDefinition/ccda-performer-extension) (CONF:2219-2573).
This event MAY contain zero or one [0..1] code (CONF:2219-2572).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] section (CONF:2219-2597) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] section (CONF:2219-2469) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:2219-2493).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code="48765-2" (CodeSystem: LOINC urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) (CONF:2219-2494).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:2219-2495).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] U.S. DAF AllergyIntolerance Profile (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/daf/StructureDefinition/daf-allergyintolerance) (CONF:2219-2492).

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:2219-2499).

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] section (CONF:2219-2471) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:2219-2501).
